posts.title: V2ray+WS+TLS+Nginx
posts.text: Synchronize server timecentos7Update server yum update -y (Some systems prompt NO packages marked for update, no need to update)Set the server time to be adjusted to the local country time zone date -R is to view the current server time 123date -Rtimedatectl set-local-rtc 1timedatectl set-timezone Asia/Shanghai DebianE.g123date -Rrm -rf /etc/localtimecp /usr/share/zoneinfo/Asia/Shanghai /etc/localtime Install dependent programsdebianupdate and Install curl 12apt updateapt install curl centos7update and Install curls 12yum makecacheyum install curl Continue code installation12curl -O https://raw.githubusercontent.com/v2fly/fhs-install-v2ray/master/install-release.shcurl -O https://raw.githubusercontent.com/v2fly/fhs-install-v2ray/master/install-dat-release.sh v2ray update1bash install-release.sh code outputThe output content of different v2ray versions will be different " + " is addÔºå" - " is delete123456789101112131415161718192021222324+info: unzip is installed.+info: Extract the V2Ray package to /tmp/tmp.RS0y2YR2ZS/ and prepare it for installation.+installed: /usr/local/bin/v2ray+installed: /usr/local/bin/v2ctl+installed: /usr/local/lib/v2ray/geoip.dat+installed: /tmp/tmp.KojGXm19Pa/+info: V2Ray v4.27.0 is installed. install release.sh1bash install-dat-release.sh edit configuration files123cd /usr/local/etcmkdir v2raytouch config.json Create a configuration file named config.json under /usr/local/etc/v2rayCopy the following code to config.json 12345678910111213141516171819202122232425262728293031323334353637383940414243444546474849505152535455565758596061626364656667//copy{ "log" : { "access": "/var/log/v2ray/access.log", "error": "/var/log/v2ray/error.log", "loglevel": "warning" }, "inbound": { "port": 9000, "listen": "127.0.0.1", "protocol": "vmess", "settings": { "clients": [ { "id": "eb950add-608e-409d-937f-e797324387093z", "level": 1, "alterId": 12 } ] }, "streamSettings":{ "network": "ws", "wsSettings": { "path": "/ray" //Related to nginx configuration (customizable) } } }, "outbound": { "protocol": "freedom", "settings": {} }, "outboundDetour": [ { "protocol": "blackhole", "settings": {}, "tag": "blocked" } ], "routing": { "strategy": "rules", "settings": { "rules": [ { "type": "field", "ip": [ "0.0.0.0/8", "10.0.0.0/8", "100.64.0.0/10", "127.0.0.0/8", "169.254.0.0/16", "172.16.0.0/12", "192.0.0.0/24", "192.0.2.0/24", "192.168.0.0/16", "198.18.0.0/15", "198.51.100.0/24", "203.0.113.0/24", "::1/128", "fc00::/7", "fe80::/10" ], "outboundTag": "blocked" } ] } }} v2ray debugging 12sudo systemctl restart v2raysudo systemctl status -l v2ray Set v2ray to boot up 1systemctl enable v2ray open http 80 prot and https 443 prot Open firewall https 443 prot and htpp 80 prot123sudo firewall-cmd --permanent --zone=public --add-service=httpsudo firewall-cmd --permanent --zone=public --add-service=httpssudo firewall-cmd --reload install NGINX123456789sudo yum install epel-release #epelsudo yum install nginxsudo systemctl enable nginx.servicesudo systemctl start nginx.service 12345678debugging codeÔºösudo systemctl start nginx.service //start Nginxsudo systemctl stop nginx.service //stop Nginxsudo systemctl status -l nginx.service //start Nginxsudo systemctl restart nginx.service //restart Nginxsudo systemctl disable nginx.service //disable Nginxsudo systemctl reload nginx.service //reload Nginx (If change the Nginx configuration, you need to reload the data)sudo systemctl enable nginx.service //enable nginx Nginx installed by the above method, all related configuration files are in the /etc/nginx/ directoryThe main configuration file of Nginx is /etc/nginx/nginx.confNginx log files (access.log and error.log) are located in the /var/log/nginx/ directory If you can‚Äôt use it successfully after the setup is complete, it may be due to the SElinux mechanism (if you are a user of CentOS 7, please pay special attention to the SElinux mechanism) that prevents Nginx from forwarding data to the intranetIf this is the case, there will be no access information in the V2Ray log, and a large number of ‚ÄúPermission Denied‚Äù fields will appear in the Nginx logTo solve this problem, you need to type the following command in the terminal: 1setsebool -P httpd_can_network_connect 1 //Only centos7 use To verify whether Nginx is successfully started, you can open http://YOUR_IP in the browser. Note: Open it and display the centos webpage, but it prompts insecure websites that SSL encryption is not turned on https Generate tls certificate1.Install the acem.sh certificate generation tool. The following 3 methods are provided. Choose any one of the methods to install the certificate tool (Reminder: automatically upgrade acme.sh and enter acme.sh upgrade under root) 1234567curl https://get.acme.sh | sh // please install curl first yum -y install curlwget -O - https://get.acme.sh | sh //please install wget first enter yum -y install wget has been installed ignoregit clone https://github.com/acmesh-official/acme.sh.git // please install git first enter yum install gitcd ./acme.sh./acme.sh --install 1234567centos7 yum install socat #Generate tls certificate through port 80centos7 yum install netcatdebian apt-get install openssl cron socat curldebian apt-get -y install netcatsource ~/.bashrc2. Generate the certificate path under the /root/.acme.sh file, you can check it yourself after installation Reminder: There are many ways to generate a certificate through acme.sh: For example ‚Äî automatic DNS API integration such as: cloudflare DNS API token and use of global API key acme.sh supports most dns to generate certificates For example ‚Äî use DNS manual mode, and many other installation methods, if you are a good learner, you can Google The generated certificate is as follows: This video only uses the designated port to generate the certificate. **It is recommended to use the 443 port to generate the certificate** (usually a single domain name is sufficient, after all, it is used to overcome the wall and do not need to do so many fancy multi-domains, such as: main domain baidu.com is not recommended to use www.baidu.com, because it is the front-end web that overturns the wall, please customize such as tw.baidu.com, the prefix tw can be customized, please control three characters, the main domain baidu.com and the secondary www .baidu.com can spare you understand) Apply for a certificate by listening on port 80, if port 80 is occupied, please use port 443, please make sure these ports are open 1sudo ~/.acme.sh/acme.sh --issue -d domain name --standalone -k ec-256 Listen to port 443 to issue certificates, please make sure port 443 is open 1sudo ~/.acme.sh/acme.sh --issue -d domain name --alpn -k ec-256 If you use non-standard port 443 behind the reverse proxy or load balancer, you can use ‚Äìtlsport to specify the port 1sudo ~/.acme.sh/acme.sh --issue -d domain name --alpn --tlsport port -k means the length of the key, the following values ‚Äã‚Äãcan be ec-256, ec-384, 2048, 3072, 4096, 8192, with ec means that the generated ECC certificate is, if not, it is the RSA certificate. In terms of security, a 256-bit ECC certificate is equivalent to a 3072-bit RSA certificate tls move1/etc/v2ray ÔºàThe path can be customizedÔºâ 1sudo ~/.acme.sh/acme.sh --installcert -d --fullchainpath /etc/v2ray/v2ray.crt --keypath /etc/v2ray/v2ray.key --ecc Configure *.confvim /etc/nginx/nginx.conf #Enter the edit configuration file: long press the D key on the keyboard to delete all configuration information, and then press the keyboard Ins key to enter the editing mode. Copy the following code and paste it into the configuration for editing, and fill in the corresponding one After configuring the information. Finally, press the shift+: key on the keyboard at the same time, enter wq to save and exit 12345678910111213141516171819202122232425262728293031323334353637383940414243444546474849505152535455565758596061user nginx;worker_processes auto;error_log /var/log/nginx/error.log;pid /run/nginx.pid;include /usr/share/nginx/modules/*.conf;events { worker_connections 1024;}http { log_format main '$remote_addr - $remote_user [$time_local] "$request" ' '$status $body_bytes_sent "$http_referer" ' '"$http_user_agent" "$http_x_forwarded_for"'; access_log /var/log/nginx/access.log main; sendfile on; tcp_nopush on; tcp_nodelay on; keepalive_timeout 65; types_hash_max_size 2048; include /etc/nginx/mime.types; default_type application/octet-stream; include /etc/nginx/conf.d/*.conf;server { listen 80; server_name https://%$##@@.com; rewrite ^/(.*) https://%$$%^.com$1 permanent; #your URL} server { # SSL configuration listen 443 ssl http2 default_server; listen [::]:443 ssl http2 default_server; ssl_certificate /etc/v2ray/*.pem ssl_certificate_key /etc/v2ray/*.key; ssl_ciphers EECDH+CHACHA20:EECDH+CHACHA20-draft:EECDH+ECDSA+AES128:EECDH+aRSA+AES128:RSA+AES128:EECDH+ECDSA+AES256:EECDH+aRSA+AES256:RSA+AES256:EECDH+ECDSA+3DES:EECDH+aRSA+3DES:RSA+3DES:!MD5; ssl_protocols TLSv1.1 TLSv1.2 TLSv1.3; root /usr/share/nginx/html; server_name #your URL location /ray { proxy_redirect off; proxy_pass http://127.0.0.1:prot; proxy_http_version 1.1; proxy_set_header Upgrade $http_upgrade; proxy_set_header Connection "upgrade"; proxy_set_header Host $http_host;}}} 1ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA512:DHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA512:ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384:DHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384:ECDHE-RSA-AES256-SHA384; #RSAÂ•ó‰ª∂ 1EECDH+CHACHA20:EECDH+CHACHA20-draft:EECDH+ECDSA+AES128:EECDH+aRSA+AES128:RSA+AES128:EECDH+ECDSA+AES256:EECDH+aRSA+AES256:RSA+AES256:EECDH+ECDSA+3DES:EECDH+aRSA+3DES:RSA+3DES:!MD5; #Ecc After modifying the Nginx configuration, must be to reload the configuration. Enter sudo systemctl reload nginx.service #This must be done Finally, please enter reboot to restart the server(remember to execute) 1reboot Check whether ssl is enabled. Open the website https://myssl.com/ssl.html and enter your own domain name and port 443 or open https://www.ssllabs.com/ssltest/index.html to query, you can also search for the keyword ssl on Google Query, many websites can query, whether the score has reached A level Reminder: To generate a certificate through the acme.sh tool, please use the 443 port code as follows: sudo ~/.acme.sh/acme.sh ‚Äìissue -d domain name ‚Äìalpn -k ec-256 (listen to port 443 To issue a certificate, please make sure that port 443 is turned on. Follow the procedure of the article to operate port 80. When generating a certificate, you will be prompted that the port is occupied. Of course, if you want to be simpler, you can pass the certificate you have purchased or apply for the pagoda or other certificates, and put the key and certificate directly Copy the copy to the specified path of the server, and configure nginx to point to the certificate and path. Some free certificates will lack the CA certificate, so the website ssl score will be greatly reduced. The solution is to re-add the CA certificate. Check if you find that the website has a lock by entering your domain name in the browserüîí https is turned on, and the ssl score of the website domain name has reached A. If yes, congratulations on the successful construction. If you have learned it, then the next course will be better The more interesting it gets. BBr installation1wget "https://github.com/chiakge/Linux-NetSpeed/raw/master/tcp.sh" && chmod +x tcp.sh && ./tcp.sh uninstall V2Ray1bash install-release.sh --remove Query tls statushttps://www.ssllabs.com/ssltest/index.html Enter your own domain name to query Reminder: If you want to improve yourself in a short period of time, you can participate in my training. posts.title: Centos7 upgrade python2 to python3
posts.text: Linux‚Äôs centos7 has python2.7.5 installed by default, and needs to be upgraded to the latest version View python version1python -V View soft link direction1ls -al /usr/bin/python Rename soft connection1mv /usr/bin/python /usr/bin/python2.7.5 Download and unzip python12wget https://www.python.org/ftp/python/3.6.4/Python-3.6.4.tgztar -xf Python-3.6.4.tgz Install python1234cd Python-3.6.4./configuremakemake install python3.6.4 has been installed in the system. python2.7.5 has been renamed due to soft link. and so. When you check the python version. Will not exist 12Command: python -VResult: -bash: /usr/bin/python: No such file or directory Let the system use Python 3.6.4 by defaultThe direction of the soft link has been modified. Yum cannot be used at this time. Need to edit the yum configuration file 1vi /usr/bin/yum Put the file header 1#!/usr/bin/python Change to 1#!/usr/bin/python2.7.5 Save and exit! shift+: enter wq Create a new link123rm -rf /usr/bin/pythonrm -rf /usr/bin/pyln -s /usr/local/bin/python3.6 /usr/bin/python Verification is successful1python -V

posts.title: v2ray VS Trojan
posts.text: Trojan15%V2ay90% v2ray vmess multi-layer encryption is too safe to change socks, trojan stands at attention and stands! ! ! Do you really understand v2ray? I discussed trojan and v2ray with you in Telegram before! So I am writing an article today! Bloggers have used v2ray for many years, can they be very responsible to tell everyone that v2ray is currently the most secure encryption, multi-layer encryption, is it considered insecure and outdated? It‚Äôs nonsense! No matter what FQ service you use here, we respect it, but we really feel that some UPs are ignorant and mislead many people. At present, v2ray has been taken over by the v2fly project and the public test of vless is also effective! And other important updates‚Ä¶! ! So why am I writing this blog post today? It is because I want to tell some novices that v2ray can drop the current mainstream FQ service in seconds. Trojan is blown up!Because v2ray is an all-rounder, there are really few UPs that can really make V2ray clear on YouTube. Because v2ray is more complicated to configure than other services, but it has powerful functions. In order to better hide the characteristics of the traffic, v2ray+tls+ws+nginx was born, TLS is a layer of encryption, and vmess is also a layer of encryption. However, the vmess protocol requires a relatively large amount of calculation. And Trojan‚Äôs Dansheng is improved in this respect, it is direct tls encryption, so it should be faster. So is it true that v2ray cannot be compared with trojan?NO Today, let‚Äôs talk about socks! The socks protocol is definitely less computationally intensive than the vmess protocol. For example, ss, ssr, boork are finally connected to us by the socks5 protocol, and network games must pass through socks5, so it is impossible to calculate too much. Socks does not have that much encryption either, SOCKS is actually a network proxy protocol. SOCKS proxy is divided into SOCKS4 and SOCKS5. The difference between the two is that SOCKS4 proxy only supports TCP protocol (that is, transmission control protocol), while SOCKS5 proxy supports both TCP protocol and UDP protocol (that is, user data packet protocol). Various authentication mechanisms, server-side domain name resolution, etc. SOCKS5 that SOCK4 can do are available, but SOCK4 that SOCKS5 can do may not be able to do it! There is no need for time-based calculations like vmess.But I know that the socks protocol used to play games is definitely no problem. SOCKS is completely different from general application layer proxy servers. The general application layer proxy server works at the application layer and provides different processing methods for different network applications, such as HTTP, SMTP, etc. Once a new network application appears, the application layer proxy server cannot provide a proxy for the application , So the scalability of the application layer proxy server is not good; different from the application layer proxy server, the SOCKS proxy server aims to provide a generalized S proxy work and then the circuit layer (that is, between the application layer and the transport layer)!So today we will talk about v2ray+tls+ws+nginx! After the configuration is successful, v2ray (no vmess or vless protocol)+tls+ws+nginx! Speed ‚Äã‚Äãwill certainly not let you down! Everyone knows ss or ssr! ! ! v2ray server/usr/local/etc/v2ray1234567891011121314151617181920212223{ "inbounds": [{ "port": port, "listen": "127.0.0.1", "protocol": "socks","sniffing":{ "enabled": true, "destOverride": ["http", "tls"]},"settings":{ "auth": "noauth", "udp": false, "userLevel": 10},"streamSettings":{"network":"ws","wsSettings":{"path":"/comebey520"}} }], "outbounds": [{ "protocol": "freedom", "settings": {} }]} v2ray client configuration123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233{ "inbounds": [{ "port": 1080, //v2ray default 10808 SOCKS5 port actual situation fill in "protocol": "socks", "sniffing": { "enabled": true, "destOverride": ["http", "tls"] }, "settings": { "auth": "noauth", "udp": false } }], "outbounds": [{ "protocol": "socks", "settings":{ "servers": [{ "address": "Your domain name", "port": 443 }]}, "streamSettings": { "network": "ws", "security": "tls", "wsSettings": { "path": "/comebey520" //Keep the server and client the same } } }]} Nginx configuration/etc/nginx/nginx.conf12345678910111213141516171819202122232425262728293031323334353637383940414243444546474849505152535455565758596061user nginx;worker_processes auto;error_log /var/log/nginx/error.log;pid /run/nginx.pid;include /usr/share/nginx/modules/*.conf;events { worker_connections 1024;}http { log_format main'$remote_addr-$remote_user [$time_local] "$request" ' '$status $body_bytes_sent "$http_referer" ' '"$http_user_agent" "$http_x_forwarded_for"'; access_log /var/log/nginx/access.log main; sendfile on; tcp_nopush on; tcp_nodelay on; keepalive_timeout 65; types_hash_max_size 2048; include /etc/nginx/mime.types; default_type application/octet-stream; include /etc/nginx/conf.d/*.conf;server { listen 80; server_name domain name; rewrite ^/(.*) https://domain name$1 permanent; #fill in your own domain name} server #key code{ # SSL configuration listen 443 ssl http2 default_server; listen [::]:443 ssl http2 default_server; ssl_certificate /path/*.pem; #Your ssl certificate *.crt or *.pem can be ssl_certificate_key /path/*.key; #your ssl key ssl_ciphers EECDH+CHACHA20:EECDH+CHACHA20-draft:EECDH+ECDSA+AES128:EECDH+aRSA+AES128:RSA+AES128:EECDH+ECDSA+AES256:EECDH+aRSA+AES256:RSA+AES256:EECDH+ECDSA+3DES:EECDH +aRSA+3DES:RSA+3DES:!MD5; #The suite RSA and ecc are not the same, I will give them separately below ssl_protocols TLSv1.1 TLSv1.2 TLSv1.3; root /usr/share/nginx/html; #webpage path, here you can also put your own html website to replace it server_name domain name; #your server domain name location /ray {#/ray Remember that the path needs to be consistent with the v2ray server and client. The name can be customized proxy_redirect off; proxy_pass http://127.0.0.1:port; #This IP address and port need to be consistent with the v2ray server configuration, proxy_http_version 1.1; proxy_set_header Upgrade $http_upgrade; proxy_set_header Connection "upgrade"; proxy_set_header Host $http_host;}}} TipsPlease copy all code articles on this site for some YouTube UP to indicate the source! Please respect copyright and labor achievements!

posts.title: V2ray vless+WS+TLS+Nginx
posts.text: Currently VLESS does not have its own encryption, please use it for reliable channels, such as TLS.VLESS is in the public beta. During the test, please ensure that both the client and server v2ray-core are the latest version.The internal test warehouse of VLESS is rprx/v2ray-vless, and the new version of the PREVIEW series will be merged into [v2fly/v2ray-core] after a period of release (https://github.com/v2fly/v2ray-core). Please upgrade the v2ray core client to the latest version by yourself StraightforwardNo matter what vps you build, please test the server to your local delay, including the line, including vps uplink and downlink. Regarding the choice of vps, I don‚Äôt recommend any brand, because the region is different, choose the one that suits you. I have tested the code of each article. Some friends who build V2ray or other FQ services say that the card is slow. Install BBR first. Of course, if you don‚Äôt even know the basic performance of your own server, is it a bullshit? Knowledge needs to be accumulated, come on! Please also fight for yourself and respect knowledge! If you encounter any problems during the operation, welcome add public telegram group Please indicate the source of the site-wide script for some youtube UPs, please respect the fruits of labor Install dependenciesDebianInstallation dependencies 12apt updateapt install curl Centos7Installation dependencies 12yum makecacheyum install curl Execute the following code after installation12curl -O https://raw.githubusercontent.com/v2fly/fhs-install-v2ray/master/install-release.shcurl -O https://raw.githubusercontent.com/v2fly/fhs-install-v2ray/master/install-dat-release.sh Install and update V2Ray1bash install-release.sh Code outputThe latest maintenance version of v2fly pulls the latest data and outputs the following content "+" represents the current output content, "-" represents the information deleted on the basis of the old version each line of code "+", "-" is ignored123456789101112131415161718192021222324+info: unzip is installed.+info: Extract the V2Ray package to /tmp/tmp.RS0y2YR2ZS/ and prepare it for installation.+installed: /usr/local/bin/v2ray+installed: /usr/local/bin/v2ctl+installed: /usr/local/lib/v2ray/geoip.dat+installed: /usr/local/lib/v2ray/geosite.dat+installed: /usr/local/etc/v2ray/config.json-installed: /usr/local/etc/v2ray/00_log.json-installed: /usr/local/etc/v2ray/01_api.json-installed: /usr/local/etc/v2ray/02_dns.json-installed: /usr/local/etc/v2ray/03_routing.json-installed: /usr/local/etc/v2ray/04_policy.json-installed: /usr/local/etc/v2ray/05_inbounds.json-installed: /usr/local/etc/v2ray/06_outbounds.json-installed: /usr/local/etc/v2ray/07_transport.json-installed: /usr/local/etc/v2ray/08_stats.json-installed: /usr/local/etc/v2ray/09_reverse.json-installed: /var/log/v2ray/+installed: /var/log/v2ray/access.log+installed: /var/log/v2ray/error.log+installed: /etc/systemd/system/v2ray.service+installed: /etc/systemd/system/v2ray@.service+removed: /tmp/tmp.KojGXm19Pa/+info: V2Ray v4.27.0 is installed. Install the latest geoip.dat and geosite.dat1bash install-dat-release.sh Create and edit configuration files1cd /usr/local/etc/v2ray Create a configuration file named config.json under /usr/local/etc/v2rayCopy the following code to config.json /usr/local/etc/v2ray/config.json123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930{ "inbounds": [ { "port": 36240, "listen":"127.0.0.1", "protocol": "vless", "settings": { "decryption": "none", "clients": [ { "id": "*&*&***&*&*^*&*&*&*&*&*", "level": 0 } ] }, "streamSettings": { "network": "ws", "wsSettings": { "path": "/abcde" } } } ], "outbounds": [ { "protocol": "freedom", "settings": {} } ]} v2ray debugging 12sudo systemctl restart v2raysudo systemctl status -l v2ray Set v2ray to boot up 1systemctl enable v2ray Open port 80 (HTTP) and 443 (HTTPS) (If you have watched my previous videos, make sure the firewall rules are set, Google Cloud can ignore it. For other brand servers, please make sure that ports 80 and 443 have been opened. If not, try the following Code operation or server web sideOpen http80 port and https 443 port) You can also use the following commands to open these two ports: Please turn on the firewall yourself 123sudo firewall-cmd --permanent --zone=public --add-service=httpsudo firewall-cmd --permanent --zone=public --add-service=httpssudo firewall-cmd --reload Install NGINX123456789#Install EPEL warehouse (Google Cloud ignores this step, if you are using another brand of vps server, please install it first if EPEL is not installed)sudo yum install epel-release#Install Nginx [yum remove nginx If you want to delete nginx uninstall command]sudo yum install nginxsudo systemctl enable nginx.service #Set the boot to start Nginxsudo systemctl start nginx.service #Start Nginx service 1234567891011121314151617181920The debugging code is as follows:sudo systemctl start nginx.service //Open Nginxsudo systemctl stop nginx.service //Stop Nginxsudo systemctl status -l nginx.service //View Nginx running statussudo systemctl restart nginx.service //Restart Nginxsudo systemctl disable nginx.service //Cancel the boot to start Nginxsudo systemctl reload nginx.service //Reload Nginx (such as changing Nginx configuration requires reloading data)sudo systemctl enable nginx.service //start on boot The debugging code is as follows: Nginx debugging also does not need to add **.service** after the code, please **sudo systemctl start nginx.service**And **sudo systemctl enable nginx.service** Then you can debug through the following code.sudo systemctl start nginx //Open Nginxsudo systemctl stop nginx //Stop Nginxsudo systemctl status -l nginx //View Nginx running statussudo systemctl restart nginx //Restart Nginxsudo systemctl disable nginx //cancel Nginx startupsudo systemctl reload nginx //Reload Nginx (such as changing Nginx configuration requires reloading data)sudo systemctl enable nginx //start up Nginx installed by the above method, all related configuration files are in the /etc/nginx/ directoryThe main configuration file of Nginx is /etc/nginx/nginx.conf*Nginx log files (access.log and error.log) are located in the /var/log/nginx/ directory. * If you can‚Äôt use it successfully after the setup is complete, it may be due to the SElinux mechanism (if you are a user of CentOS 7, please pay special attention to the SElinux mechanism) preventing Nginx from forwarding data to the intranetIf this is the case, there will be no access information in the V2Ray log, and a large number of ‚ÄúPermission Denied‚Äù fields will appear in the Nginx logTo solve this problem, you need to type the following command in the terminal: 1setsebool -P httpd_can_network_connect 1 //Very important debian ignore To verify whether Nginx is successfully started, you can open http://YOUR_IP in your browser. Note: Open it will display the centos webpage, but it prompts insecure websites that SSL encryption is not turned on https Generate Certificate*If you already have other certificates, you can ignore them, put the certificate and key in the specified directory of the server, just specify the certificate and key path in Nginx. There are too many ways to apply for a certificate. You can generate a certificate by installing the acme.sh tool or other methods to generate a certificate. You can search on Google. * 1. Install the acem.sh certificate generation tool. The following provides 3 methods to install, choose any one of them to install the certificate tool (Reminder: automatically upgrade acme.sh and enter acme.sh upgrade under root) 1234567curl https://get.acme.sh | sh // If the installation fails, please install curl first and enter yum -y install curlwget -O-https://get.acme.sh | sh //If it prompts that the installation fails, please (install wget first) enter yum -y install wget already installed ignoregit clone https://github.com/acmesh-official/acme.sh.git // If the installation fails, install git first. Ignore those already installed. Enter yum install gitcd ./acme.sh./acme.sh --install Install acme.sh through the above code and prompt red hold error. You can install dependencies according to the actual situation, such as installing socat or netcat 1234567centos7 yum install socat #Dependency of generating certificate through port 80centos7 yum install netcatdebian apt-get install openssl cron socat curldebian apt-get -y install netcatAfter the installation is successful, execute source ~/.bashrc to ensure that the command alias set by the script takes effect2. Generate the certificate path under the /root/.acme.sh file, you can check it yourself after installation Reminder: There are many ways to generate a certificate through acme.sh: For example ‚Äî automatic DNS API integration such as: cloudflare DNS API token and use of global API key acme.sh supports most dns to generate certificates For example ‚Äî use DNS manual mode, and many other installation methods, if you are a good learner, you can Google The generated certificate is as follows: This video only uses the designated port to generate the certificate. **It is recommended to use the 443 port to generate the certificate** (Generally, a single domain name is sufficient, after all, it is used for overcoming the wall without having to do so many bells and whistles. For baidu.com, it is not recommended to use www.baidu.com, because it is the front-end web over the wall, please customize such as tw.baidu.com, the prefix tw can be customized, please control three characters, the primary domain baidu.com and the secondary www .baidu.com can spare you understand) 1. Apply for a certificate by listening on port 80, if port 80 is occupied, please use port 443, please make sure these ports are open 1sudo ~/.acme.sh/acme.sh --issue -d domain name --standalone -k ec-256 2. If you use a non-standard port 80 behind the reverse proxy or load balancer, you can use ‚Äìhttpport to specify the port 1sudo ~/.acme.sh/acme.sh --issue -d domain name --standalone --httpport port 3. Listen on port 443 to issue certificates, please make sure port 443 is open 1sudo ~/.acme.sh/acme.sh --issue -d domain name --alpn -k ec-256 4. If you use non-standard port 443 behind the reverse proxy or load balancer, you can use ‚Äìtlsport to specify the port 1sudo ~/.acme.sh/acme.sh --issue -d domain name --alpn --tlsport port -k means the length of the key, the following values ‚Äã‚Äãcan be ec-256, ec-384, 2048, 3072, 4096, 8192, with ec means that the generated ECC certificate is, and if it is not, it is the RSA certificate. In terms of security, a 256-bit ECC certificate is equivalent to a 3072-bit RSA certificate 8. Install the certificate and key to the specified path1/etc/v2ray (path can be customized) 123ecc installation code sudo ~/.acme.sh/acme.sh --installcert -d domain name --fullchainpath /etc/v2ray/v2ray.crt --keypath /etc/v2ray/v2ray.key --eccrsa installation code sudo ~/.acme.sh/acme.sh --installcert -d domain name --fullchainpath /etc/v2ray/v2ray.crt --keypath /etc/v2ray/v2ray.key 9. Configure NGINX *.confReminder: Code comments do not need to be deleted and will not affect the operation, I just make it easier to understandvi /etc/nginx/nginx.conf #Enter the edit configuration file: long press the D key on the keyboard to delete all configuration information, and then press the keyboard Ins key to enter the editing mode. Copy the following code and paste it into the configuration for editing, and fill in the corresponding one After configuring the information. Finally, press the shift+: key on the keyboard at the same time, enter wq to save and exit /etc/nginx/nginx.conf12345678910111213141516171819202122232425262728293031323334353637383940414243444546474849505152535455565758596061user nginx;worker_processes auto;error_log /var/log/nginx/error.log;pid /run/nginx.pid;include /usr/share/nginx/modules/*.conf;events { worker_connections 1024;}http { log_format main'$remote_addr-$remote_user [$time_local] "$request" ' '$status $body_bytes_sent "$http_referer" ' '"$http_user_agent" "$http_x_forwarded_for"'; access_log /var/log/nginx/access.log main; sendfile on; tcp_nopush on; tcp_nodelay on; keepalive_timeout 65; types_hash_max_size 2048; include /etc/nginx/mime.types; default_type application/octet-stream; include /etc/nginx/conf.d/*.conf;server { listen 80; server_name domain name; rewrite ^/(.*) https://domain name$1 permanent; #fill in your own domain name} server #key code{ # SSL configuration listen 443 ssl http2 default_server; listen [::]:443 ssl http2 default_server; ssl_certificate /path/*.pem; #Your ssl certificate *.crt or *.pem can be ssl_certificate_key /path/*.key; #your ssl key ssl_ciphers EECDH+CHACHA20:EECDH+CHACHA20-draft:EECDH+ECDSA+AES128:EECDH+aRSA+AES128:RSA+AES128:EECDH+ECDSA+AES256:EECDH+aRSA+AES256:RSA+AES256:EECDH+ECDSA+3DES:EECDH +aRSA+3DES:RSA+3DES:!MD5; #The suite RSA and ecc are not the same, I will give them separately below ssl_protocols TLSv1.1 TLSv1.2 TLSv1.3; root /usr/share/nginx/html; #webpage path, here you can also put your own html website to replace it server_name domain name; #your server domain name location /ray {#/ray Remember that the path needs to be consistent with the v2ray server and client. The name can be customized proxy_redirect off; proxy_pass http://127.0.0.1:port; #This IP address and port need to be consistent with the v2ray server configuration, proxy_http_version 1.1; proxy_set_header Upgrade $http_upgrade; proxy_set_header Connection "upgrade"; proxy_set_header Host $http_host;}}} The kit is as follows:RSA 1ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA512:DHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA512:ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384:DHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384:ECDHE-RSA-AES256-SHA384; ECC 1EECDH+CHACHA20:EECDH+CHACHA20-draft:EECDH+ECDSA+AES128:EECDH+aRSA+AES128:RSA+AES128:EECDH+ECDSA+AES256:EECDH+aRSA+AES256:RSA+AES256:EECDH+ECDSA+3DES:EECDH+ aRSA+3DES:RSA+3DES:!MD5; After modifying the Nginx configuration, be sure to reload the configuration. Enter sudo systemctl reload nginx.service #This must be done Finally, please enter reboot to restart the server(remember to execute) 1reboot Query whether to enable ssl Open the website https://myssl.com/ssl.html and enter your own domain name, port 443 or open https://www.ssllabs.com/ssltest/index.html to query, you can also search for the keyword ssl on Google Query, many websites can query, whether the score has reached A level Reminder: Please use the 443 port code to generate the certificate through the acme.sh tool as follows: sudo ~/.acme.sh/acme.sh ‚Äìissue -d domain name ‚Äìalpn -k ec-256 (listening to port 443 To issue a certificate, please make sure that port 443 is turned on. When you operate port 80 to generate a certificate according to the procedure of the article, you will be prompted that the port is occupied. Of course, if you want to be simpler, you can pass the certificate you have purchased or apply for the pagoda or other certificates, and put the key and certificate directly Copy the copy to the specified path of the server, and configure nginx to point to the certificate and path. Some free certificates will lack the CA certificate, so the website ssl score will be greatly reduced. The solution is to re-add the CA certificate. Check whether the website has a lock by entering your domain name in the browserüîí https is turned on, and the ssl score of the website domain name has reached A. If yes, congratulations on the successful construction. If you have learned it, then the next course will be better The more interesting it gets. 10. BBr installation1wget "https://github.com/chiakge/Linux-NetSpeed/raw/master/tcp.sh" && chmod +x tcp.sh && ./tcp.sh v2ray clientPlease upgrade the client v2ray core to the latest version, add a custom configuration server, copy the following code and save it as **.json 1234567891011121314151617181920212223242526272829303132333435363738394041424344{"inbounds": [ { "port": 1080, "listen": "127.0.0.1", "protocol": "socks", "sniffing": { "enabled": true, "destOverride": ["http", "tls"] }, "settings": { "auth": "noauth", "udp": false } } ], "outbounds": [ { "protocol": "vless", "settings": { "vnext": [ { "address": "Domain Name", "port": 443, "users": [ { "encryption": "none", "id": "UUID replace yourself", "level": 0 } ] } ] }, "streamSettings": { "network": "ws", "security": "tls", "wsSettings": { "path": "/abcde" } } } ]} Query tls on statushttps://www.ssllabs.com/ssltest/index.html Enter your own domain name to query If you want to uninstall V2Ray, execute the following code1bash install-release.sh --remove Reminder: If you want to improve yourself in a short period of time, you can participate in my training. For many years of practical experience, you can participate in the excellent courses. Basically, you can't find the VIP courses on all platforms. Seeing blood for a while helps you get through the second line of the governor, everyone can be an expert„ÄÇClick on course detailschat telegram group Nginx Theme template download

posts.title: Github API
posts.text: For users who use Github, there are often some automation requirements. For example, my requirement is to regularly backup Github issues and comments locally. The following is a reference for using Github‚Äôs API Basic Access Path (Root Endpoints) When reading the document at the beginning, follow its example to curl directly on the command line, or access it in InSomnia or Postman software, and the 200 status is perfectly displayed. But once I rewrite my username in the link, it will display 404 without page. I thought it was an authorization problem, and then tried various ways in the header HEADER for username and token keys, but it was useless or 404. It turned out that it was not a problem with the method, but the link address was not written correctly!In fact, if you just read it, you don‚Äôt need any authorization at all. You can directly enter the link in the command line, Insomnia, web page and other situations to access all public information of anyone.Then check the official path list Root Endpoints to get the link, it seems that how to access it is wrong. Instead, I saw a link in Stackoverflow. I found various correct access paths along the way, summarized as follows: First of all! The visited link cannot have / at the end. For example, https://api.github.com/users/solomonxie can access my personal information, but https://api.github.com/users/solomonxie/ does not work. The only difference is that there is one more/.Second! Unlike general URL access, Github‚Äôs API access links are case sensitive!Personal main information. https://api.github.com/users/ username, the data obtained is as follows:image Personally owned repo. https://api.github.com/users/username/repos. Will get a list of repo in JSON format.Repo details. https://api.github.com/repos/username/warehouse name. The path of the repo began to be different from the personal information.Get the content list of a repo. https://api.github.com/repos/solomonxie/gists/contents, note that this will only return the contents of the root directory.Get the content list of subdirectories in the repo. https://api.github.com/repos/solomonxie/gists/contents/ directory name. It must be noted that the capitalization of the original file name must be completely followed here, otherwise the information cannot be obtained. If it is a deeper content, write the name of the directory in the link column in order.Get information about a file in the repo (not including content). https://api.github.com/repos/solomonxie/gists/contents/ file path. The file path is the full path of the file and is case sensitive. Only basic file information will be returned.Get the original content (Raw) of a file. 1. Extract the download_url link from the above file information, and then you can get its original content. 2. Or visit directly: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/username/warehouse name/branch name/file pathA list of all commits in the repo. https://api.github.com/repos/username/warehouse name/commits.Details of a certain commit. https://api.github.com/repos/username/warehouse name/commits/SHA of a certain commitList of issues. https://api.github.com/repos/username/repository name/issues.Details of an issue. https://api.github.com/repos/username/warehouse name/issues/ serial number. Issues are listed in the order of 1, 2, and 3.A list of comments in an issue. https://api.github.com/repos/username/warehouse name/issues/serial number/comments.Details of a comment. https://api.github.com/repos/Username/Repository Name/issues/comments/ ID of comment details. The comment ID is obtained from the issues list. Query parameters (Parameters)If you add query conditions to the basic link above, then the returned data is filtered. For example, it is required to return only the open issues, or to display the list data in pages. Commonly used as follows: Paging function. The format is?page=page number&per_page=each page contains number.Such as https://api.github.com/users/solomonxie/repos?page=2&per_page=3 Issue status. The format is?state=state.Such as https://api.github.com/repos/solomonxie/solomonxie.github.io/issues?state=closed

posts.title: v2ray configure TLS encryption
posts.text: Finalshell SSH connection tool downloadMobaxterm SSH connection tool download 1. Server time synchronizationSet the hardware clock to be consistent with the local clock, set the time zone to Shanghai date -R is to view the current time of the servercentos7 time synchronization 123date -Rtimedatectl set-local-rtc 1timedatectl set-timezone Asia/Shanghai Debian system synchronization time is as follows: 123date -Rrm -rf /etc/localtimecp /usr/share/zoneinfo/Asia/Shanghai /etc/localtime debianInstallation dependencies 12apt updateapt install curl centos7Installation dependencies 12yum makecacheyum install curl 2. Install dat and release.sh12curl -O https://raw.githubusercontent.com/v2fly/fhs-install-v2ray/master/install-release.shcurl -O https://raw.githubusercontent.com/v2fly/fhs-install-v2ray/master/install-dat-release.sh 3. Install and update V2Ray1bash install-release.sh Install v2ray and enter the followingThe latest maintenance version of v2fly pulls the latest data and outputs the following content "+" represents the current output content, "-" represents the information deleted on the basis of the old version each line of code "+", "-" is ignored123456789101112131415161718192021222324+info: unzip is installed.+info: Extract the V2Ray package to /tmp/tmp.RS0y2YR2ZS/ and prepare it for installation.+installed: /usr/local/bin/v2ray+installed: /usr/local/bin/v2ctl+installed: /usr/local/lib/v2ray/geoip.dat+installed: /usr/local/lib/v2ray/geosite.dat+installed: /usr/local/etc/v2ray/config.json-installed: /usr/local/etc/v2ray/00_log.json-installed: /usr/local/etc/v2ray/01_api.json-installed: /usr/local/etc/v2ray/02_dns.json-installed: /usr/local/etc/v2ray/03_routing.json-installed: /usr/local/etc/v2ray/04_policy.json-installed: /usr/local/etc/v2ray/05_inbounds.json-installed: /usr/local/etc/v2ray/06_outbounds.json-installed: /usr/local/etc/v2ray/07_transport.json-installed: /usr/local/etc/v2ray/08_stats.json-installed: /usr/local/etc/v2ray/09_reverse.json-installed: /var/log/v2ray/+installed: /var/log/v2ray/access.log+installed: /var/log/v2ray/error.log+installed: /etc/systemd/system/v2ray.service+installed: /etc/systemd/system/v2ray@.service+removed: /tmp/tmp.KojGXm19Pa/+info: V2Ray v4.27.0 is installed. 4. Install the latest geoip.dat and geosite.dat1bash install-dat-release.sh 5. Create and edit configuration files1cd /usr/local/etc/v2ray Create a new config.json configuration file under /usr/local/etc/v2rayCopy the following code to config.json /usr/local/etc/v2ray12345678910111213141516171819202122232425262728293031323334{ "inbounds": [ { "port": 443, // port 443 is recommended "protocol": "vmess", "settings": { "clients": [ { "id": "23ad6b10-8d1ae3e35cd38297", //UUID "alterId": 64 //extra id } ] }, "streamSettings": { "network": "tcp", //The protocol replaces itself such as WS "security": "tls", // security must be set to tls to enable TLS "tlsSettings": { "certificates": [ { "certificateFile": "/etc/v2ray/v2ray.crt", // certificate file "keyFile": "/etc/v2ray/v2ray.key" // key file } ] } } } ], "outbounds": [ { "protocol": "freedom", "settings": {} } ]} v2ray debugging 12sudo systemctl restart v2raysudo systemctl status -l v2ray Set v2ray to boot up 1systemctl enable v2ray 6. Generate a certificate*If you already have other certificates, you can ignore them. Put the certificate and key in the specified directory of the server. There are too many ways to apply for a certificate. You can generate a certificate by installing the acme.sh tool or other methods to generate a certificate. You can search on Google. * 1. Install the acem.sh certificate generation tool. The following provides 3 methods to install, choose any one of them to install the certificate tool (Reminder: automatically upgrade acme.sh and enter acme.sh upgrade under root) /root/.acme.sh1234567curl https://get.acme.sh | sh // If the installation fails, please install curl first and enter yum -y install curlwget -O-https://get.acme.sh | sh //If it prompts that the installation fails, please (install wget first) enter yum -y install wget already installed ignoregit clone https://github.com/acmesh-official/acme.sh.git // If the installation fails, install git first. Ignore those already installed. Enter yum install gitcd ./acme.sh./acme.sh --install Install acme.sh through the above code and prompt red to hold wrong. You can install dependencies according to the actual situation, such as installing socat or netcat 1234567centos7 yum install socat #Dependency of generating certificate through port 80centos7 yum isntall netcatdebian apt-get install openssl cron socat curldebian apt-get -y install netcatAfter the installation is successful, execute source ~/.bashrc # to ensure that the command alias set by the script takes effect 2. Generate the certificate path under the /root/.acme.sh file, you can check it yourself after installation Reminder: There are many ways to generate a certificate through acme.sh: For example ‚Äî automatic DNS API integration such as: cloudflare DNS API token and use of global API key acme.sh supports most dns to generate certificates For example ‚Äî use DNS manual mode, and many other installation methods, if you are a good learner, you can Google The generated certificate is as follows: This video only uses the specified port to generate the certificate It is recommended to use the 443 port to generate the certificate (Generally, a single domain name is sufficient, after all, it is used to overcome the wall and do not need to do so many bells and whistles, such as the main domain baidu. com is not recommended to use www.baidu.com because it is the front-end web over the wall, please customize such as tw.baidu.com, the prefix tw can be customized, please do not write too long, the main domain baidu.com and secondary www.baidu. com can spare you understand) 1. Apply for a certificate by listening on port 80, if port 80 is occupied, please use port 443, please make sure these ports are open 1sudo ~/.acme.sh/acme.sh --issue -d domain name --standalone -k ec-256 2. If you use a non-standard port 80 behind the reverse proxy or load balancer, you can use ‚Äìhttpport to specify the port 1sudo ~/.acme.sh/acme.sh --issue -d domain name --standalone --httpport port 3. Listen on port 443 to issue certificates, please make sure port 443 is open 1sudo ~/.acme.sh/acme.sh --issue -d domain name --alpn -k ec-256 4. If you use non-standard port 443 behind the reverse proxy or load balancer, you can use ‚Äìtlsport to specify the port 1sudo ~/.acme.sh/acme.sh --issue -d domain name --alpn --tlsport port -k means the length of the key, the following values ‚Äã‚Äãcan be ec-256, ec-384, 2048, 3072, 4096, 8192, with ec means that the generated ECC certificate is, and if it is not, it is the RSA certificate. In terms of security, a 256-bit ECC certificate is equivalent to a 3072-bit RSA certificate Reminder: If port 80 or 443 is occupied and we cannot apply for the key and certificate, we can block the port through kill and apply again. 12345678netstat -tlnp|grep 80ornetstat -tlnp|grep 443thenkill 1103 (this 1103 is the process port id)If it cannot be terminated, it can be terminated forciblykill -9 1103 7. Install the certificate and key to the specified path/etc/v2ray (path can be customized) 123ecc installation code sudo ~/.acme.sh/acme.sh --installcert -d domain name --fullchainpath /etc/v2ray/v2ray.crt --keypath /etc/v2ray/v2ray.key --eccrsa installation code sudo ~/.acme.sh/acme.sh --installcert -d domain name --fullchainpath /etc/v2ray/v2ray.crt --keypath /etc/v2ray/v2ray.key Modify /etc/v2ray/v2ray.key to 644 permissions 1chmod 644 /etc/v2ray/v2ray.key 8. BBr installation1wget "https://github.com/chiakge/Linux-NetSpeed/raw/master/tcp.sh" && chmod +x tcp.sh && ./tcp.sh 9. Query tls on statushttps://www.ssllabs.com/ssltest/index.html Enter your own domain name to queryAbout config.json configuration file can be written by yourself, of course, it also includes various other load balancing, reverse proxy. If you want to improve yourself in a short time, you can participate in my training class. 10. If you want to uninstall V2Ray, execute the following code1bash install-release.sh --remove chat telegram group

posts.title: Set server login password
posts.text: centos7After getting root privileges, modify the SSH configuration file /etc/ssh/sshd_config 123vim /etc/ssh/sshd_configChange PasswordAuthentication no to yesChange PermitRootLogin no to yes Set a password, enter it twice, enter do not prompt any characters 1passwd Restart the SSH service, and finally use the account as root and the password for the third-party SSH login that you just set. 1service sshd restart Debian 9 and 10 1234apt-get install ssh #Select installationvim /etc/ssh/sshd_config#PermitRootLogin prohibit-password changed to PermitRootLogin yes#PasswordAuthentication no changed to PasswordAuthentication yes Set a password, enter it twice, enter do not prompt any characters 1passwd Restart the SSH service, and finally use the account as root and the password for the third-party SSH login that you just set. 1sudo /etc/init.d/ssh restart

posts.title: Firewall settings
posts.text: 1. View firewall statusBasic use of firewalldsystemctl is the main tool in the service management tools of CentOS7, which integrates the functions of the previous service and chkconfigstart up: 1systemctl start firewalld View: 1systemctl status firewalld stop: 1systemctl disable firewalld Disable: 1systemctl stop firewalld Service: /sbin/chkconfig ‚Äìadd foo put the newly generated foo.service under /usr/lib/systemd/system/, and then use the load command to import systemctl load foo.serviceStart a service: 1systemctl start firewalld.service Turn off a service: 1systemctl stop firewalld.service Restart a service: 1systemctl restart firewalld.service Display the status of a service: 1systemctl status firewalld.service To enable a service at boot: 1systemctl enable firewalld.service Generally, the machine needs to be restarted, otherwise the settings made later may not take effect Two, open or restrict ports Open portsIf we need to open the 22 port that needs to be used when shell connection1firewall-cmd --zone=public --add-port=22/tcp --permanent Among them, the role of ‚Äìpermanent is to make the settings take effect permanently, otherwise the machine will become invalid after restarting. Reload the firewall settings to make the settings effective 1firewall-cmd --reload You can check whether it takes effect through the following command 1firewall-cmd --zone=public --query-port=22/tcp The following command can view all ports opened by the current system 1firewall-cmd --zone=public --list-ports Three, limit portsFor example, we now need to turn off the 22 port just opened 1firewall-cmd --zone=public --remove-port=22/tcp --permanent Reload the firewall settings to make the settings effective 1firewall-cmd --reload Go to check all the open ports of the system, there is no 22 port 1firewall-cmd --zone=public --list-ports Four, batch open or restrict portsOpen ports in batches. For example, we have to open all ports from 100 to 500 1firewall-cmd --zone=public --add-port=100-500/tcp --permanent Reload the firewall settings to make the settings effective 1firewall-cmd --reload Check all the open ports of the system, you can see that all ports from 100 to 500 have been opened 1firewall-cmd --zone=public --list-ports Similarly, the batch limit port is 12firewall-cmd --zone=public --remove-port=100-500/tcp --permanentfirewall-cmd --reload Five, open or restrict IP Restrict IP address accessFor example, restricting the IP address of 192.168.0.200 to prohibit access to port 80 means prohibiting access to the machine1firewall-cmd --permanent --add-rich-rule="rule family="ipv4" source address="192.168.0.200" port protocol="tcp" port="80" reject" Reload the firewall settings to make the settings effective 1firewall-cmd --reload View the rules that have been set 1firewall-cmd --zone=public --list-rich-rules Remove IP address restrictionsRemove the restricted 192.168.0.2001firewall-cmd --permanent --add-rich-rule="rule family="ipv4" source address="192.168.0.200" port protocol="tcp" port="80" accept" Reload the firewall settings to make the settings effective 1firewall-cmd --reload Check the rule settings again and find that there is no 192.168.0.200 limit 1firewall-cmd --zone=public --list-rich-rules If the settings are not effective, you can try to edit the rules file directly, delete the original setting rules, and reload the firewall. 1vi /etc/firewalld/zones/public.xml Limit IP address segmentFor example, we need to restrict the IP of the entire segment of 10.0.0.0-10.0.0.255 and prohibit them from accessing1firewall-cmd --permanent --add-rich-rule="rule family="ipv4" source address="10.0.0.0/24" port protocol="tcp" port="80" reject" Among them, 10.0.0.0/24 means starting from the IP 10.0.0.0, 24 represents the subnet mask is 255.255.255.0, which contains a total of 256 addresses, that is, a total of 256 IPs from 0-255, which just limits this entire The IP address of the segment, the specific setting rules can refer to the following table Reload the firewall settings to make the settings effective 1firewall-cmd --reload Check the rules to confirm whether they are in effect 1firewall-cmd --zone=public --list-rich-rules Similarly, the opening limit is 12firewall-cmd --permanent --add-rich-rule="rule family="ipv4" source address="10.0.0.0/24" port protocol="tcp" port="80" accept"firewall-cmd --reload

posts.title: Shadowsocks native deployment
posts.text: 1. Preparation1.root permission 1sudo -i 2. System package update 1yum update 2. Download and install pip123curl "https://bootstrap.pypa.io/get-pip.py" -o "get-pip.py" #download pippython get-pip.py #install pip 3. Install SS and configure SS parameters1. Install shadowsocks 1pip install shadowsocks 2. Enter vi /etc/shadowsocks.json with root authority to configure shadowsocks parameters. If you can't enter vi, you can use nano or vim to configure 1vi /etc/shadowsocks.json 123456{ "server":"0.0.0.0", "server_port":8388, "password":"password", "method":"aes-256-cfb"} Four. Create a startup script1vi /etc/systemd/system/shadowsocks.service 1234567[Unit]Description=Shadowsocks[Service]TimeoutStartSec=0ExecStart=/usr/bin/ssserver -c/etc/shadowsocks.json[Install]WantedBy=multi-user.target Reminder: Shadowsocks needs to install the libsodium encryption library, otherwise you can only use‚Äúaes-256-cfb‚Äùand other encryption protocols cannot be used. Please execute the following code: 123wget https://github.com/jedisct1/libsodium/releases/download/1.0.18-RELEASE/libsodium-1.0.18.tar.gztar xf libsodium-1.0.18.tar.gz && cd libsodium-1.0.18 5. Debugging service12345systemctl enable shadowsocks #Make the service ss service effective and start upsystemctl start shadowsocks #start sssystemctl status shadowsocks -l #View status Then install BBR acceleration by yourselfReminder: Do you really understand? It is easy to use for friends who know how to use ss, and for friends who do not know how to use ss, even if you are using v2ray or trojan GFW, it is easy to wall your IP. No matter you use any circumvention software, most of the situations are People, in whose hands it is used, shadowsocks can also be used with services such as NGINX, and CDN can also be added. Don‚Äôt be broken by some UP main belts. Any problem will be a bullshit if it can‚Äôt stand the verification.

posts.title: SSR multi-user script construction
posts.text: Build environment centos7/debian system sudo -i1sudo -i Install Curl on ubuntu system1apt-get update -y && apt-get install curl -y Centos install Curl and wget12yum update -y && yum install curl -yyum install wget Install one-click script1wget -N --no-check-certificate https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ComeBey/more-user-ssr/master/hasan.sh && chmod +x hasan.sh && bash hasan.sh Invoke command debugging1bash hasan.sh

posts.title: Brook crontab use
posts.text: Choose one of the following synchronization time. If you cannot synchronize the local time, please google the next one (keywords such as centos7 or centos6 or debian time synchronization local time) Method 1. Calibrate time and synchronize local time date -R view vps time sudo -i root permission to enter``yum -y install ntp ntpdate //install ntpdate toolntpdate cn.pool.ntp.org //Set the system time to synchronize with the local network timehwclock ‚Äìsystohc //write system time into hardware time 12345678**Method 2. Calibrate time to synchronize local time date -R to view vps time**``yum install ntp //install ntp servicesystemctl enable ntpd //Start the servicesystemctl start ntpd //Start the servicetimedatectl set-timezone Asia/Shanghai//Change time zonetimedatectl set-ntp yes //Enable ntp synchronizationntpq -p //Sync time ** crontab service **``/ sbin / service crond start (open crontab without any prompt indicating it has been opened)/sbin/service crond status (view status) 123456789101112131415Install crontab: (Some systems do not have crontab installed, you need to install it, if the system itself is already installed, please skip this step)** yum install crontabs ** (install crontab)##Service operation instructions:``/ sbin / service crond start (start service)/ sbin / service crond stop (turn off the service)/sbin/service crond restart (restart service)/ sbin / service crond reload (reload configuration//reload configuration)/sbin/service crond status (check whether crond is running normally) crontab -e (Enter the i key, copy the following code ctrl + c, paste ctrl + v to join the scheduled task, you can customize and add the required functions) `` / 1 * * * *Date>>~/a.log 2>&1 / 1 * * * * sudo journalctl -b -u brook >>~/ a.log 2>&1 / 1 * * * * /bin/systemctl restart brook.service >>~/a.log 2>&1123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233343536373839404142434445464748495051525354555657585960616263646566676869707172737475767778798081828384858687888990919293949596979899100101102103104105106107108109110111112113114115116117118119120121122123124125126127128129130131132133134``crontab -l (view the crontab tasks that have been added)tail~/a.log View the last 10 logsMore/root/a.log View all logstail -f /var/log/cron to view normal running crontab scheduled tasksVerify the running status of crontab scheduled task brookThe output can be filtered according to specific segmentsjournalctl -b displays all logs after this startup:journalctl -f view the progress being outputsudo journalctl -b -u Brook view Brooke statusman 1 journalctl view all the usage of journalctlrm -rf~/a.log log clearing methodExample 1: execute a command every 1 minutecommand:* * * * *Command Example 2: Execute at the 3rd and 15th minutes of every hourcommand:3,15 * * * *Command Example 3: Execute at the 3rd and 15th minutes from 8 am to 11 amcommand:3,15 8-11 * * *Command Example 4: Execute at the 3rd and 15th minutes from 8 am to 11 am every two dayscommand:3,15 8-11 * / 2 * *Command Example 5: Execute on the 3rd and 15th minutes from 8 am to 11 am every Mondaycommand:3,15 8-11 * * 1 command Example 6: Restart at 21:30 every nightcommand:30 21 * * * /etc/init.d/smb restart Example 7: Restart at 4:45 on the 1, 10, and 22 of each monthcommand:45 4 1,10,22 * * /etc/init.d/smb restart Example 8: Restart at 1:10 every Saturday and Sundaycommand:10 1 * * 6,0 /etc/init.d/smb restart Example 9: Restart smb every 30 minutes from 18:00 to 23:00 every daycommand:0,30 18-23 * * * /etc/init.d/smb restart Example 10: restart every Saturday at 11:00 pmcommand:0 23 * * 6 /etc/init.d/smb restart Example 11: Restart smb every hourcommand:* * / 1 * * * /etc/init.d/smb restart Example 12: Between 11 pm and 7 am, restart smb every hourcommand:* 23-7 / 1 * * * /etc/init.d/smb restart Example 13: Restart smb on the 4th of every month and 11 o‚Äôclock every Monday to Wednesdaycommand:0 11 4 * mon-wed /etc/init.d/smb restart Example 14: restart smb at 4 o'clock on January 1stcommand:0 4 1 jan * /etc/init.d/smb restart Example 15: Execute the script in the /etc/cron.hourly directory every hourcommand:01 * * * *Root running component /etc/cron.hourly

posts.title: Brook install
posts.text: 1. Update server Enter sudo -i to enter root privileges, you can choose to upgrade the kernel, yum update -y upgrades the kernel yum install wget download wget tool wget https://github.com/txthinking/brook/releases/download/v20190205/brook download brook server version Enter cp brook /usr/bin to copy brook to the bin directory chmod +x /usr/bin/brook gives the current path brook executable permissions brook -h #View help nohup ./brook server -l :80 -p pass1234 & add brook port and password and let brook run in the background Copy the following code 1234567sudo -iyum update -yyum install wgetwget https://github.com/txthinking/brook/releases/download/v20190205/brookcp brook /usr/binchmod +x /usr/bin/brooknohup ./brook server -l :80 -p pass1234 & Brook settings start with the systemvi /etc/systemd/system/brook.service Create brook.service startup script with viToPress ‚Äúi‚Äù to enter insert mode, enter the script as follows 123456789 [Unit] Description = This is brook [Service] ExecStart = /usr/bin/./brook server -l :80 -p pass1234 [Install] WantedBy = multi-user.targetTo Press Esc, enter ‚Äúshift+:‚Äù, enter wq, press Enter, save and exit Give executable attributes and take effect: 1chmod +x /etc/systemd/system/brook.service Open brook.service service 1systemctl enable /etc/systemd/system/brook.service reboot restart vps Check if brook service is running normallyThe following code: 1234service brook status -l will return to green if started normally active (running)service brook start start brook serviceservice brook stop stop brook runningservice brook restart restart brook service systemctl list-unit-files Check whether the Brook script takes effect. After re-modifying the Brook password, we need to reload the information and enter systemctl daemon-reload or restart vps and enter reboot
